Mental health is one of the biggest challenges of our time. We've got to do all we can to continue improving both access to mental health care, as well as the care itself.

If you or someone you know is struggling with mental health, call 800-950-6264 or text "NAMI" to 741741.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: Support shouldn't be hard to find or afford. That's why I'm working to get Medicare to cover mental health services, and why I've worked with both parties to simplify and strengthen the National Suicide Prevention and Mental Health Crisis Hotline.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
We also have to keep in mind the folks who work their tails off caring for us: our health care professionals.

These heroes have been put through the wringer these last two years, which is why we codified protections for their mental health into law at the end of last year.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
When it comes to caring for our fighting men and women, we must remember there are unseen wounds of war.

We passed my Hannon Act to bolster VA's mental health workforce and increase rural veterans' access to care, and I'm pushing to ensure it’s implemented as Congress intended.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
We can't ignore the mental health crisis happening in rural America.

My Seeding Rural Resilience Act and the funding I secured for mobile services were critical first steps, but we need to double down by passing my bills to expand tele-mental health services and coverage.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
Mental health is as important as physical health, and it's critical to address challenges early.

We invested in school mental health services with the American Rescue Plan, and I've got a bill to build on these resources and give students the tools they need for the long haul.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:

They deserve nothing less.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
The Department also announced a plan to refine the eligibility requirements to ensure the Caregivers Program is meeting the intent of Congress.

I was glad to see the Biden Administration take our concerns and the concerns of veterans and caregivers across the country seriously.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
Together, we held VA's feet to the fire.

We held hearings. We sent letters. We got input from VA officials, VSOs, and caregivers on how to improve the Program.

And just last month, VA announced a slew of changes—including a halt on discharging legacy participants.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
A few years ago, the previous administration was set to tighten the Program's eligibility requirements and unfairly deny access.

Hearing concerns from veterans and caregivers alike, I raised hell—but they did it anyways.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
Tomy and Dara are two of many Montanans who know firsthand how vital the Caregivers Program is to our vets. Tomy sacrificed a whole lot for our country, and Dara had to work part-time to help him get the care he deserved.

Family farm agriculture is vital to our nation's food security, and I'll never stop fighting to defend our great tradition. From one farmer to another, happy #NationalAgDay!

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: Farmers will save time and money when we pass my long overdue Agriculture Right to Repair Act. This bill will force big equipment manufacturers to make software and tools available on reasonable terms so farmers can fix their own equipment—just as they've always done.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
We've been fighting for years to cut red tape and expand access to interstate markets for Montana ranchers, and yesterday, we made a lot of progress.

We need to provide certainty for producers across the country and pass my New Markets for State-Inspected Meat and Poultry Act.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
Everyone west of the Mississippi knows that Montana beef is a cut above the rest.

It's critical for Montana families to know exactly what they're buying at the supermarket, and my bipartisan American Beef Labeling Act will ensure ONLY American beef is marked "Product of USA."

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: We've got to keep small operations strong, and fair and transparent prices are essential to that. With my bipartisan spot pricing bill, we'll establish regional mandatory minimum thresholds for negotiated cash and grid cattle trades to ensure producers can meet their bottom line.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
For years, anti-competitive practices in the meatpacking industry have been running family ranchers out of business.

It's time we crack down and put real teeth in the Packers and Stockyards Act—my bipartisan Meat Packing Special Investigator Act will do just that.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
A whole lot of people in Congress claim to understand what folks in production ag need—but a lot fewer of them actually do.

I'm fighting to pass commonsense bills to address consolidation in the industry and get our family farmers and ranchers a fair shake. 🧵 #NationalAgDay

name: Senator Jon Tester

name: Senator Jon Tester

These are some effective steps I'm fighting for that'll bring down the cost of prescription drugs for Montana seniors and families.

Congress has done a lot of talking about reining in drug costs, but it's high time we start doing. Montanans don't have time to waste. (8/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
Lastly, and this is a big one, we need to get aggressive on lowering the cost of prescription drugs like insulin. Insulin is essential for some folks to live—yet the cost of a single vial has skyrocketed.

We need to make insulin affordable right away. (7/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: We've also got to cap out-of-pocket costs for Medicare Part D patients, as well as eliminate the Part D coverage gap to ensure more folks can access the drugs they need. (6/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: In recent years, we have seen some companies jack up the costs of vital prescription drugs for no other reason than they can—and that's just plain wrong. (5/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
Montana seniors need relief immediately, and another way we can tackle this issue head on is by letting Medicare negotiate prescription drug prices.

With this power, Medicare can leverage its large market share to bring down prices for beneficiaries. Let's make it happen. (4/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: But the work isn’t done yet. This week, I led a bipartisan group of 30 Senators in urging @CMSGov to stop all retroactive DIR fees, period. This commonsense reform could reduce seniors' out-of-pocket drug costs by more than $21 billion over the next decade. (3/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
In December, I secured a commitment from @CMSGov to address hidden DIR fees charged by corporate middlemen that drive up drug costs for patients and put small pharmacies out of business.

Cracking down on these fees will lower drug costs for Medicare Part D beneficiaries. (2/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: And last but not least, my Spotlight Act shines a light on dark money donors and gives the government the tools it needs to enforce our campaign finance laws, reversing a Trump-era rule that eliminated donor disclosure requirements for certain tax-exempt organizations. (7/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: The Honest Ads Act would require disclaimers on digital ads and require large online platforms to keep a public database of who is purchasing political ads—ensuring digital ads have the same requirements as those on TV or radio and letting folks know who is paying for them. (6/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: The DISCLOSE Act would keep foreign actors from participating in American elections and increase transparency for major donors, so Montanans know exactly who is paying for the constant ads that flood their TVs and mailboxes during election season. (5/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: The Cleaning Up Washington's Act, another bill of mine, would close the revolving door between D.C. lobbyists and Capitol Hill by banning former members of Congress and the Executive Branch from lobbying for five years after leaving civil service. (4/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: I've also got the SUN Act, which would bring political spending out of the shadows by requiring tax-exempt non-profit organizations that engage in political activity to publicly disclose information about their big money online donors. (3/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: My Corporations Are Not People Act is a constitutional amendment that would overturn the Supreme Court's harmful Citizens United decision and declare once and for all that corporations are NOT people. (2/8)

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: Ultimately, my bipartisan legislation is about two things: creating good-paying jobs for Montanans and ensuring we remain the leading economic power in the world. This bill does that and more, and I’m proud to have worked with Republicans and Democrats to get it passed.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
Water 🚰💧
 
Water is life. This legislation completes all authorized Indian water rights settlements in Montana, and I secured $1 billion to complete all authorized rural water projects through the Bureau of Reclamation, as well as up to $100 million for the Milk River Project.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
Fire Resiliency 🧑‍🚒👨‍🚒
 
Fire season has gotten worse year after year in Montana, and that’s why this bill includes $3.37 billion to reduce wildfire risk through additional funding for firefighter salaries, research, and community resiliency.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
High-Speed Internet 💻📶
 
This legislation provides billions to expand high-speed internet to underserved areas and it will increase connectivity in every corner of Montana so we can create good-paying jobs and grow our small businesses.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
Roads and bridges 🛣🌉
 
Montana’s economy depends on safe, efficient travel across our state, and this package invests roughly $2.82 billion to repair and upgrade Montana’s roads, highways, and bridges.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: Took a question about dark money in our elections. Let’s be clear here, corporations aren’t people and Montanans know that. If you put a bill on the floor of the Senate that clarified that, it would pass.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: Was just asked about civic engagement. The decisions we make today will have a tremendous impact on young people in this country. As leaders we can inspire the next generation by keeping politics out of our decision making and doing what’s right for the country. It’s that simple.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: I just got a question about suicide rates in Montana. I've got a bill to address this crisis that would be a good start, but we have to keep pushing. We need more mental health professionals on the ground and we have to reduce the stigma around mental health in rural America.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: Was just asked about our climate. We’ve got ice sheets that are melting, we’ve got oceans that are rising, we’ve got bugs in our crops and in our forests that we've never had before. We have to work together to do something about our changing climate.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: Just got a question about legislative gridlock in the Senate. We're supposed to be the greatest deliberative body in the world, but we don't debate much anymore. If we actually did the work of debating the issues, I think we'd come up with a whole heckuva lot more solutions.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: One of the first questions is about protecting public lands. Let's be clear, one of the things that makes Montana great is our public lands. You don't have to be a millionaire and own a ranch to go hunting or a stream to go fishing. I'm always going to fight to keep it that way.

I look forward to his response. https://t.co/sfkfM4szek

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: In Montana, public lands are the bedrock that support our sportsmen, ranchers, small businesses, and local governments. Montanans deserve to know how Mr. Pendley will maintain and defend our public lands—or if he will at all.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: William Pendley was appointed to head the @BLMNational  despite his long history of advocacy for selling off public lands and opposing federal land management.  He has clear conflicts of interest between his past work and ongoing lawsuits involving the BLM.

We've got to stop it. https://t.co/8TQDASL2WT

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: Wildfires can be devastating. The last thing folks recovering from the aftermath of a fire need to worry about is filing their taxes. My bill will help Montanans by giving them more time and flexibility to file so they can focus on what matters most – safety and recovery. https://t.co/a0BamnwAsC

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: RT @MarshaBlackburn: We have to bring our veterans’ care into the 21st century. I joined @SenatorTester in demanding that @DeptVetAffairs i…

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: Folks in Montana have shown Washington the way — now it’s time for Congress to follow Montana’s lead.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: There’s no reason why we cannot make smart investments in working families, our children’s education, and 21st century infrastructure without bankrupting the future for our kids and grandkids.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: It is possible to be fiscally responsible without cutting working folks off at the knees — I negotiated and passed a balanced budget while serving as the President of the Montana Senate.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
Spending is about priorities. 

It’s clear that Congress’ priorities are out of whack.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: These same colleagues that added this 2 trillion dollars of debt are now arguing we don’t have enough money to provide for our veterans, pay for Medicare, Social Security, and other programs that protect hundreds of thousands of Montanans.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
They promised this tax giveaway would pay for itself — it did not. 

In fact, it tacked 2 trillion dollars into the national debt.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: My Republican colleagues passed a partisan tax giveaway that was drafted behind closed doors with no public input form Montanans.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: Our debt is not skyrocketing because we are spending it on things we need like updates infrastructure or investments in education — it’s skyrocketing because of irresponsible spending.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: The bipartisan Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget projects that this Administration’s policies will add 4 trillion dollars to the debt over the next ten years.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: This week, we will vote on a bill that swipes Washington’s credit card to the tune of about 250 billion dollars over the next two years — dollars are coming from the pockets of our kids and grandkids.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: As usual, Washington could learn a lot from Montana.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: Folks in Montana are resilient and resourceful — they know how to live within their means.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text: As I travel across Montana, I hear from folks who work tirelessly everyday to make ends meet — families facing the ever-rising costs of housing, healthcare, and other basic necessities.

name: Senator Jon Tester
tweet_text:
I’m headed to the Senate floor in a few moments to discuss how Montana common sense can help solve our skyrocketing national debt. 

Tune in HERE ➡️ https://t.co/S215HKxj00
